page.title: 12Roads and Footpaths
page.content: {The Military Road}is the only major road in this area.It was made many years ago for the movement of troops from end to end of the island if necessary.It runs from Chale to Freshwater.It is maintained by the IWCC and brings people from all parts to see this beautiful and as yet unspoilt part of the Wight.The other roads are very minor having passing places and limits of 3 TONS except for access.There are no pavements along the roads,but the numerous footpaths and coastal walks are clearly signed. There are lay-bys and carparks along the Military Road and these may be used for short walks along the cliffs. Sometimes there are public footpaths down to the shore through chines,from which walks in either direction may be taken.In most cases these footpaths are signposted.
